author: amy.bartner@indystar.com
title: Indy experiences a 'Day Without Immigrants'

persons.name: robert scheer/indystar fullscreen buy photo rosa angeles

text: Indy experiences a 'Day Without Immigrants' Amy Bartner , amy.bartner@indystar.com Published 6:35 p.m. ET Feb. 16, 2017 | Updated 5 hours ago Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Buy Photo Viviana Torres, 6, Indianapolis, during a march and rally today dubbed A Day without Immigrants, that went from Garfield Park to the Statehouse and involved more than 250 people, Indianapolis, Thursday, February 16, 2017. The event mirrored companion events in other cities that invited immigrants to not spend money or participate in work, school or other civic activities for the day. Robert Scheer/IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Jenny Nunes, Indianapolis, an immigrant from Mexico, makes photos during a march and rally today dubbed A Day without Immigrants, that went from Garfield Park to the Statehouse and involved more than 250 people, Indianapolis, Thursday, February 16, 2017. The event mirrored companion events in other cities that invited immigrants to not spend money or participate in work, school or other civic activities for the day. The event mirrored companion events in other cities that invited immigrants to not spend money or participate in work, school or other civic activities for the day.
